features.title: How It Works
features.feature1Text: Browse hundreds of animals from shelters near you. Filter by species, age, location, and more.
features.feature2Text: Answer 5 simple questions to get personalized pet recommendations based on your lifestyle.
features.feature3Text: Contact shelters directly and start your adoption journey. Make a difference in a pet's life.

partnerShelters.title: Our Partner Shelters
partnerShelters.text: We work with trusted animal shelters to bring you verified, up-to-date listings of animals looking for their forever homes.

cta.title: Ready to Meet Your Match?
cta.text: Whether you want to browse our full catalog or get personalized recommendations, we'll help you find the perfect companion.

about.title: About PawCompass
about.subtitle: We promote friendships between dogs and humans
about.missionText: At PawCompass, we believe every pet deserves a loving home and every pet owner deserves a perfect companion. We're building a platform that connects compassionate people with amazing animals from trusted shelters.

quiz.title: Find your ideal dog
quiz.subtitle: Answer the following questions to find the ideal dog for you.
quiz.resultSubtitle: Based on your answers, here are the ideal dogs for you:
quiz.noMatchText: Unfortunately, we couldn't find a dog that perfectly matches your answers. Try again with different answers or by

questions.dogExperience: Dog experience: How much experience do you already have with dogs? (1 = no experience, 7 = a lot of experience)
questions.householdChildren: Children in the household: How important is it to you that your dog is very fond of children? (1 = not important, no children present; 7 = very important, children are part of the household)
questions.livingSituation: Living situation: Do you live in a rather cramped or very spacious home? (1 = small city apartment without a garden; 7 = large house with a large garden)
questions.soloAtHome: Left alone: Will your dog regularly have to stay home alone for long periods of time? (1 = no, almost never alone; 7 = yes, many hours every day)
questions.activityLevel: Activity level: How would you describe your own lifestyle? (1 = rather quiet, not very athletic; 7 = very active, ready for long walks and outdoor adventures every day)
questions.educationEffort: Training effort: How important is it to you that your dog is easy to train and obeys quickly? (1 = not so important, also likes challenges; 7 = very important, should be as easy to train as possible),
questions.protectiveInstinct: Protective instinct: Is it important to you that your dog protects your home and family and is alert? (1 = not at all, I prefer a calm/friendly temperament; 7 = yes, a strong guarding and protective instinct is desirable)
questions.furCare: Coat care: How important is it to you that your dog sheds little and requires minimal grooming? (1 = not important, I have no problem with that; 7 = very important, grooming should be minimal),
questions.otherPets: Other pets: Do you already have other pets (e.g., cats) in your household that the dog would have to get used to? (1 = no, no other animals; 7 = yes, there are already pets that must be dog-friendly),
questions.size: Desired size: Which dog size suits your preferences and possibilities better? (1 = preferably a small dog up to approx. 10 kg; 7 = preferably a very large dog over 40 kg)
